andhra_pradesh.name: Venkateswara Temple
andhra_pradesh.info: Dravidian-style temple on Tirumala hills, one of the richest and most visited Hindu temples in the world.

arunachal_pradesh.name: Malinithan Temple Ruins
arunachal_pradesh.info: Archaeological site dedicated to Krishna and Rukmini, showing early Hindu influence in Northeast India.

assam.name: Kamakhya Temple
assam.info: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas, dedicated to Goddess Kamakhya. A key center of Tantric worship.

bihar.name: Mahabodhi Temple
bihar.info: UNESCO World Heritage Site where Buddha attained enlightenment under the Bodhi Tree.

chhattisgarh.name: Bhoramdeo Temple
chhattisgarh.info: Often called 'Khajuraho of Chhattisgarh', known for exquisite stone carvings and Nagara-style architecture.

goa.name: Tambdi Surla Mahadev Temple
goa.info: 12th-century Kadamba-Yadava period temple dedicated to Shiva; oldest surviving in Goa.

gujarat.name: Somnath Temple
gujarat.info: First among the 12 Jyotirlingas; repeatedly rebuilt, symbol of resilience and devotion.

haryana.name: Kurukshetra Brahma Sarovar
haryana.info: Sacred tank linked to the Mahabharata; pilgrims believe a dip here cleanses all sins.

himachal_pradesh.name: Baijnath Temple
himachal_pradesh.info: Nagari-style stone temple dedicated to Shiva; built in 1204 CE by merchants Ahuka and Manyuka.

jharkhand.name: Baidhyanath Dham
jharkhand.info: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas; major pilgrimage destination in eastern India.

karnataka.name: Hampi Virupaksha
karnataka.info: Part of the Group of Monuments at Hampi — Vijayanagara period architecture.

kerala.name: Sabarimala Temple
kerala.info: Famous Ayyappa shrine located in the Western Ghats, visited by millions annually.

madhya_pradesh.name: Khajuraho Temples
madhya_pradesh.info: UNESCO World Heritage group of temples famed for intricate erotic sculptures and Nagara-style art.

maharashtra.name: Ellora Caves (Kailasa)
maharashtra.info: Rock-cut monolithic temple complex with Kailasa temple dedicated to Shiva.

manipur.name: Shree Govindajee Temple
manipur.info: 18th-century temple built by Maharaja Nara Singh; main Vaishnavite center of Manipur.

meghalaya.name: Nartiang Durga Temple
meghalaya.info: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas; features both Hindu and indigenous Khasi rituals.

mizoram.name: Solomon's Temple
mizoram.info: Modern temple inspired by biblical Solomon’s Temple; cultural landmark of Mizoram.

nagaland.name: Dimapur Kachari Ruins
nagaland.info: Megalithic ruins attributed to the Kachari civilization, reflecting pre-Aryan culture.

odisha.name: Konark Sun Temple
odisha.info: 13th-century CE Sun temple, famous for its chariot-shaped architecture and stone wheels.

punjab.name: Golden Temple (Harmandir Sahib)
punjab.info: Holistic Sikh shrine with gold-plated sanctum surrounded by the sacred Amrit Sarovar.

rajasthan.name: Dilwara Temples
rajasthan.info: White marble Jain temples built between 11th–13th century CE, known for exquisite carvings.

sikkim.name: Rumtek Monastery
sikkim.info: Seat of the Karmapa of Tibetan Buddhism; major monastery in Eastern Himalayas.

tamil_nadu.name: Brihadeeswarar Temple
tamil_nadu.info: Built by Raja Raja Chola I (11th century CE). Classic Chola architecture; UNESCO World Heritage (Great Living Chola Temples).

telangana.name: Ramappa Temple
telangana.info: UNESCO World Heritage site built by Kakatiya rulers in 13th century CE, famed for floating bricks.

tripura.name: Tripura Sundari Temple
tripura.info: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas; temple houses a 5,000-year-old idol of Goddess Tripurasundari.

uttar_pradesh.name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
uttar_pradesh.info: One of the most sacred Jyotirlingas of Shiva, located on the banks of the Ganga.

uttarakhand.name: Kedarnath Temple
uttarakhand.info: 12th-century stone temple dedicated to Shiva, located in the Himalayas at 3,583 m elevation.

west_bengal.name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
west_bengal.info: 19th-century temple complex built by Rani Rashmoni, dedicated to Goddess Kali.

andaman_and_nicobar_islands.name: Sri Vetrimalai Murugan Temple
andaman_and_nicobar_islands.info: Primary Hindu temple in the Andaman Islands, dedicated to Murugan.

chandigarh.name: Mata Mansa Devi Temple
chandigarh.info: Ancient Shakti temple near Chandigarh, highly revered during Navratri.

dadra_and_nagar_haveli_and_daman_and_diu.name: Somnath Mahadev Temple (Diu)
dadra_and_nagar_haveli_and_daman_and_diu.info: Seaside Shiva temple with Portuguese-era architecture influence.

delhi.name: Akshardham Temple
delhi.info: Modern masterpiece of Hindu architecture inaugurated in 2005, dedicated to Swaminarayan.

jammu_and_kashmir.name: Amarnath Cave Temple
jammu_and_kashmir.info: Sacred Himalayan cave shrine where the ice Shiva Lingam forms naturally each year.

ladakh.name: Hemis Monastery
ladakh.info: Largest and wealthiest monastery in Ladakh, associated with Guru Padmasambhava.

lakshadweep.name: Ujra Mosque
lakshadweep.info: 17th-century mosque known for intricate wood carvings and peaceful coastal setting.

puducherry.name: Manakula Vinayagar Temple
puducherry.info: Historic temple dedicated to Ganesha, predating French colonial era.
